More examplesFewer examplesHomography, homophony, and homonymy all concern linguistic “accidents” that cause two unrelated words to be written or pronounced in the same way.Relationships between words include those of semantic relatedness ("insect" and "entomology") and that of homography ("IT" and "it").Later, children learn to overcome homography by means of morphosyntactic cues.There are two types of homonymy: homography and homophony.
